comments:
Every once a while when I run an ant build, it will start, but the console
output does not get started, then the rest of the UI will seem responsive, but
it will shortly lock up completely, and the SRWOD (spinning rainbow wheel of
death) will kick in and only a force quit will get it to go away.  this doesn't
happen on every ant build, and it doesnt seem related to any specific ant file..
 running the same one 10x will eventually result in this lockup.  

Feel free to email me for more specifics if you want.

the last log output is:

Is is possible that you are hitting an OutOfMemoryException?
What kind of tasks are included in your Ant builds?

I'm not doing anything really stressful, just doing JSP/Servlet development and
building WARS with the Ant file.  Not very large projects, for sure.  Compiling
and building mabye 50-100 files at most.   I just had it hang again on me five
minutes ago.  I dont really know how to profile memory usage - if you want to
tell me how.. but heres a dump from 'top' - it does indicate that Eclipse is
using a good chunk of memory, but whether thats normal or not, I dont know.

*** Bug 33227 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

while debugging eclipse target i did fall on a OutOfMemoryException, after 
calling an ant target for 4 to 5 times. 
Apparantly the memory gets not released.
Is it possible to get an overview of which object is consuming all that memory, 
at the moment of the exception?

Could the jdk used to run eclipse be the problem?
Since today i'm using jdk1.4 iso jdk1.3.1_06 and up till now, (about 15 ant 
tasks started), i never got eclipse in the freeze/otofmemory state again.
Maybe i'm too early to judge but it seems that the problem has now dissappeared.
I now start eclipse using the following cmdline 

start %SUN_JDK1.4.1%/bin/javaw.exe -Xms512m -Xmx512m  -DproxySet=true -
DproxyHost=proxy.agfa.be -DproxyPort=80 -cp %SUN_JDK1.4.1%\lib\rt.jar;%
SUN_JDK1.4.1%\lib\tools.jar;C:/eclipse/startup.jar  
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -data d:\views

This problem should be solved with the latest patch we sent to the Ant team. 
The problem is that the reconciling strategy run in a separate thread 
accessing the document which can be changed by the main thread in the mean 
time.

Kai is talking about the bad location exceptions not the "hanging" problem.
I am going to mark this bug as a duplicate of the "out of memory" bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 24448 ***
